meanings.definition: To speak or utter falsely or incorrectly.
meanings.sent1: She was missaying the answer during the quiz.
meanings.sent2: He kept missaying the directions, causing confusion.
meanings.sent3: The parrot was missaying words on purpose to make everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: His missaying of the facts painted a completely different picture.
meanings.sent5: The child's constant missaying of the poem made it hard to recognize.

meanings.definition: To express oneself inaccurately or misleadingly.
meanings.sent1: The politician was missaying his promises to win votes.
meanings.sent2: She didn't realize she was missaying her feelings about the movie.
meanings.sent3: The comedian was missaying his jokes to create a comedic effect.
meanings.sent4: Her missaying of the situation made it seem more dramatic than it was.
meanings.sent5: The weather forecast was missaying the chance of rain, leading to surprises.
